page.title: 18A COUNRY CHILD'S DAY.
page.content: I get up at 7a.m. dress myself and follow my dad outside. Itack my pony, Heather and give her a trot and sometimes a canter. I get on my bike and put out the sheep. My mother calls me in. I have Kellog'S Country Store for breakfast. At 8.30a.m. I catch the school bus. When I reach school I have a talk with my friends. When the bell rings we go in and say a prayer. Sometimes we do Maths. At 10.40a.m. we go out to play. When we come in we follow our programme. At 12.30p.m. we have a school lunch.School ends at 3p.m. and I go home in the bus. At 4.35 I bring in the sheep with Glen. Then I go up the hill to feed my sheep. Sometimes a ewe has lambed. It is great fun watching the lambs take their first steps. At 9p.m. I go to bed.
